title: Elixir Labs Contract for Oregon Provider Management and Payment Platform

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Elixir Labs Contract for Oregon Provider Management and Payment Platform
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Contract awarded to Elixir Labs from the Provider Management Platform RFP,  #S-58100-00007532.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Elixir Labs Contract for Oregon Provider Management and Payment Platform
communications.communication:
Good morning Toni,

We received an email request via the platform Muckrock for a public records request. The following was the body of the email:

“Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:
Contract awarded to Elixir Labs from the Provider Management Platform RFP, #S-58100-00007532.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.”

DELC’s public record request form can be found here: Department of Early Learning and Care : Contact Us : About Us : State of Oregon<https://www.oregon.gov/delc/about-us/pages/contact-us.aspx> .
The are also separate instructions for alternate submission forms. DELC’s public records request system allows us to accurately track and communicate regarding requests and the back and forth regarding the request. I look forward to hearing from you or seeing your submission soon.

In accordance with ORS 192.324(4)(a), the public body may establish fees reasonably calculated to reimburse the public body for the public body’s actual cost of making public records available, including costs for summarizing, compiling, or tailoring the public records, either in organization or media, to meet the request.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best wishes,
[A picture containing graphics, cartoon  Description automatically generated]
Madison Buck (She/Her)​
Department of Early Learning and Care​
Public Records and Communication Specialist
DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov<mailto:DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov>
Website: Oregon.gov/DELC<https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/4T6sCW6qNgs52KYX8Ix6GqA?domain=oregon.gov>​
Connect with DELC: Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/OREarlyLearning/> | Instagram<https://www.instagram.com/OREarlyLearning/> | YouTube<https://www.youtube.com/@OREarlyLearning> | LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/company/OREarlyLearning/>

The Oregon Department of Early Learning and Care (DELC) fosters coordinated, culturally appropriate, and family-centered services that recognize and respect the strengths of children, families and early learning and care professionals. Our vision is that all children, families, early care and education professionals, and communities are supported and empowered to thrive.

title: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all contracts and/or grant agreements between City of Detroit departments or budgeted units, and fiscal sponsors (which are sometimes also referred to as fiscal intermediaries or nonprofit fiduciaries) since 2018.  

For context, Office of Chief Financial Officer Communications Manager Stephanie Davis said a nonprofit fiduciary is a philanthropic group city departments use to send funds for a particular initiative or purpose. Those funds are tied to a grant agreement outlining the duration, terms, etc. of the work. 

For example, the Mayor's Office-Mobility uses Eastside Community Network as a fiscal sponsor.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on August 1, 2024. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, August 2, 2024.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before August 23, 2024.

Your request is being handled by Amanda Kelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Amanda Kelly at kellya@detroitmi.gov<mailto:kellya@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

title: Institute for Curriculum Services (Colorado Department of Education)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Institute for Curriculum Services (Colorado Department of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any contracts between the  Education Department and the Institute for Curriculum Services, and the content of any professional development materials or presentations prepared by the Institute Curriculum Services for the Education Department since October 7th, 2022. I also request any email communication between Education Department employees and employees of the Institute for Curriculum Services since October 7th, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alex Kane

communications.subject: Colorado Department of Education Open Records Request Form
communications.communication:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Colorado Department of Education Open Records  
Request Form
Here's what was received.


Colorado Department of Education Open Records Request Form

Please use this form to submit requests for records under the Colorado Open  
Records Act. You will receive a copy of your submission to the email  
address that you provide.

A request is considered "received" by CDE on the working day that it is  
submitted. Any request received after 4:30 pm or any day CDE is officially  
closed will be considered received as of the following working day. CDE  
shall make every effort to respond within three working days, as provided  
by § 24-72-203(3)(b), CRS This three-day period begins on the first working  
day following receipt of the request.

The following is an example of a response timeline assuming that there are  
no holidays:

If a request is received before 4:30 pm on Tuesday, the three-day period  
would begin at 8 am on Wednesday and end at 5 pm on Friday.

If a request is received after 4:30 pm on Tuesday, the three-day period  
would begin at 8 am on Thursday and end at 5 pm on the following Monday.

The department may extend its response period up to seven working days if  
it finds extenuating circumstances exist and communicates that finding to  
the requestor in writing, as described in § 24-72-203(3)(b), CRS The  
extension period would begin on the fourth working day following receipt of  
the request.

Visit the CDE website for more information about our CORA policy and  
process.

communications.subject: Confirmation of receipt of CORA: Institute for Curriculum Services: Records
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon, Alex Kane-

Our procedure outlines how to properly submit a request to The Colorado Department of Education (link below):

https://www.cde.state.co.us/communications/corapolicy#procedureforrequests

To better assist you with future requests you can use the below form  (link provided):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSflZBlLha8J7Ezhxv8YfcRacQMP2qc7GekNeLdSpXSEmHLT8g/viewform

We have received your Monday, November 25th 2024 open records request seeking:

To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: Any contracts between the Education Department and the Institute for Curriculum Services, and the content of any professional development materials or presentations prepared by the Institute Curriculum Services for the Education Department since October 7th, 2022. I also request any email communication between Education Department employees and employees of the Institute for Curriculum Services since October 7th, 2022. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Alex Kane


A request is considered "received" by the Colorado Department of Education the day an e-mail, fax or letter containing a request is opened. A request received after 4:30 p.m. or any day CDE is officially closed will be considered received as of the following working day.

CDE shall make every effort to respond within three working days, as provided by § 24-72-203(3)(b), C.R.S. The three-working-day response time begins the first working day following receipt of the request.  NOTE: CDE will be closed Wednesday 27th through Friday, November 29th 2024.  We will reopen on Monday, December 2nd , 2024.  Your open records request will be due by the end of the day Monday, December 2nd 2024

The department may extend its response period up to seven working days if it finds extenuating circumstances exist and communicates that finding to the requestor in writing, as described in § 24-72-203(3)(b), C.R.S.

If you have further questions about CDE's Colorado Open Records Act policy, you can find information here: https://www.cde.state.co.us/communications/corapolicy

For additional questions, please contact Communications Director Jeremy Meyer at meyer_jeremy@cde.state.co.us<mailto:meyer_jeremy@cde.state.co.us>.


Marco Ramirez
Information Assistant
Communications Division
P 720.237.8994
201 E. Colfax Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Ramirez_Marco@cde.state.co.us | www.cde.state.co.us

communications.subject: RE: Confirmation of receipt of CORA: Institute for Curriculum Services: Records
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We are currently working on your open records request. In order to search our email database for correspondence with employees from the Institute for Curriculum Services, we will need you to provide the user name and/or the domain name. For example, in the email address "billyjoe@happycompany.com", "billyjoe" is the username, "happycompany" is the domain name, and ".com" is the extension.

Additionally, we have emails going back only 13 months from the current date. We will continue processing your request when we receive this information.

Thank you.






Jeremy Meyer
Director of Communications
Communications Division
P 720-668-6434
201 East Colfax Avenue, Room 208, Denver, CO 80203
Meyer_Jeremy@cde.state.co.us | www.cde.state.co.us
Email cannot be guaranteed to be secure or error-free as information could be intercepted, corrupted, lost, destroyed, arrive late or incomplete, or contain viruses.  Therefore, email cannot be used to transfer files containing personally identifiable information of educators or students.  Contact the intended recipient to mutually determine enhanced security options for transferring such information.

communications.communication:

I also request any email communication between Education Department employees and employees of the Institute for Curriculum Services since October 7th, 2022.”

Until you provide us with that information, we are unable to respond to that part of your request.

We will consider this request closed.


Jeremy Meyer

title: Agency Roster (Pocahontas Police Department)

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Pocahontas Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: ICE Monthly Budget Spreadsheets

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE Monthly Budget Spreadsheets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the #DetentionKills Network and its fiscal sponsor, Al Otro Lado, I hereby request finalized copies of ICE's monthly budget spreadsheet for ICE's custody management operations. This spreadsheet is likely to be maintained by the Director, the Executive Assistance Director for the Custody Management Division, and the Office of Acquisition Management, among other offices. I request these spreadsheets for each month during the FY17, FY18, FY19, FY20, and FY21 budget years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: ICE FOIA Request 2021-ICFO-32710
communications.communication:
March 22, 2021 Andrew Free MuckRock News DEPT MR 109714 411A Highland Ave Somerville, Massachusetts 02144 RE:     ICE FOIA Case Number 2021-ICFO-32710  Dear Mr. Free: This acknowledges receipt of your March 15, 2021, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for finalized copies of ICE's monthly budget spreadsheet for ICE's custody management operations for each month during the FY17, FY18, FY19, FY20, and FY21 budget years, this spreadsheet is likely to be maintained by the Director, the Executive Assistance Director for the Custody Management Division, and the Office of Acquisition Management, among other offices.  Your request was received in this office on March 15, 2021. Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10- day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you care to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 
Your request has been assigned reference number 2021-ICFO-32710. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. To check the status of an ICE FOIA/PA request, please visit . Please note that to check the status of a request, you must enter the 2021-ICFO-32710 tracking number. If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the FOIA office. You may send an e-mail to ice-foia@ice.dhs.gov, call toll free (866) 633-1182, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison, Fernando Pineiro, in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. (http://www.dhs.gov/foia-status) http://www.dhs.gov/foia-status
Regards, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009 
Telephone: 1-866-633-1182 
Visit our FOIA website at www.ice.gov/foia

communications.subject: ICE Clarification Request FOIA Number 2022-ICAP-00393
communications.communication:
January 11, 2023  Andrew Free MuckRock News DEPT MR 109714 411A Highland Ave Somerville, Massachusetts 02144  RE:     ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICAP-00393 
This e-mail is in regards to your February 15, 2022 ICE FOIA request for appealing the adequacy of the search for finalized copies of ICE's monthly budget spreadsheet for ICE's custody management operations for each month during the FY17, FY18, FY19, FY20, and FY21 budget years, this spreadsheet is likely to be maintained by the Director, the Executive Assistance Director for the Custody Management Division, and the Office of Acquisition Management, among other offices. 

In conducting a search for responsive records, the ICE FOIA office has determined that further clarification is needed regarding your request. Please provide more information and a clarified specification of the exact items sought, as we are unable to proceed with this FOIA request the way it is currentlywritten. Before it can be determinedwho within ICE has the data sought, definitions for the following termsshould be provided: 
 
  *  Budget    spreadsheet (what is meant by that?) 
  * Custody    management operations 
 Please provide the ICE FOIA office with a response as soon as possible to avoid any further delay in the processing of your request. If a response is not received within 30 days, your request will be administratively closed. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-ICAP-00599
communications.communication:
We appeal the agency’s failure to make a determination on this request, and its violation of the reasonable description regulations at 6 CFR 5.3. 

Does ICE really not know what “custody management operations” means? If so, we’d like the $2.9 billion the US government spends on it back. 

Does ICE really not know what a “budget” or a “spreadsheet” is? Or is it a “budget spreadsheet” that ICE cannot figure out how to task an adequate search for? 

Email us at Andrew@DetentionKills.org and we’ll be happy to help you find these things, or perhaps some other agency to work for that trains you better. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

Andrew Free

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICAP-00393 
 
Dear Requester: 

This e-mail is in regards to your 2/15/2022 ICE FOIA request for Records related to  finalized copies of ICE's monthly budget spreadsheet for ICE's custody management operations for each month during the FY17, FY18, FY19, FY20, and FY21 budget years, this spreadsheet is likely to be maintained by the Director, the Executive Assistance Director for the Custody Management Division, and the Office of Acquisition Management, among other offices. 

In conducting a search for responsive records, the ICE FOIA office has determined that further clarification is needed regarding your request. 
ERO is requesting more information and clarified specification of the exact items the requester is seeking and is unable to proceed with this FOIA request the way it is currently written. ERO cannot determine where these ‘spreadsheets’ are located nor which office would contain them. Please provide, if able, a sample of this document. Or a URL. Before it can be determined who within ICE has the data sought, definitions for the following terms should be provided: 

Budget spreadsheet 
Custody management operations 

Please provide the ICE FOIA office with a response as soon as possible to avoid any further delay in the processing of your request. If a response is not received within 30 days, your request will be administratively closed. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-ICAP-00393
communications.communication:
ERO is not the sole or proper custodian to task for this request, so it's not surprising they're having problems figuring out where these records live. The language of the request suggested several other custodians that ICE appears not to have tasked: 

It read: the "spreadsheet is likely to be maintained by the Director, the Executive Assistance Director for the Custody Management Division, and the Office of Acquisition Management, among other offices."

Has ICE FOIA tasked the Custody Management director and the Acting Director's office?

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-ICAP-00393
communications.communication:
Good Day,

Please be advised that several program offices have been tasked with the search for records pertaining this request. For your knowledge, the office of Custody Management is a division of ERO , so they have been properly tasked. The information for clarification is still needed to identify the spreadsheets you are requesting and for the program offices to be able to complete their searches.

Sincerely,

ICE FOIA

communications.communication:
10/21/2024 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 109714 
Somerville, Massachusetts 02144 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICAP-00393 
 
Dear Mr. Free: 

This is the final response to your 2/15/2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for appealing the adequacy of the search for finalized copies of ICE's monthly budget spreadsheet for ICE's custody management operations for each month during the FY17, FY18, FY19, FY20, and FY21 budget years, this spreadsheet is likely to be maintained by the Director, the Executive Assistance Director for the Custody Management Division, and the Office of Acquisition Management, among other offices.  Your request was received in this office on 2/15/2022. 

In an email to you on we requested clarification for your request within 30 business days. To date, we have not received a response from you or a member of your staff pertaining further clarification for the records you are seeking. 9/9/2024 

This letter advises you that we have administratively closed your request file, and no fees will be assessed. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2022-ICAP-00393. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. You may contact this office at (866) 633-1182. Our mailing address is 500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009, Washington, D.C. 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-ICAP-00393
communications.communication:
I appeal. 

I don’t know what these sheets are called because I don’t work for the government. And it’s not my job to tell the FOIA office what they’re called because, again, I don’t work for the government.  

Your clarification request violates your duty to construe the FOIA request liberally and with a presumption of openness and transparency. You’re also required to task an adequate search in response to a request that reasonably describes agency records. I believe I have done so.  You say I haven’t. The administrative closure  is a de facto denial that fails to inform me of my right to appeal. Accordingly, I reserve the right to challenge the agency’s response in court without first receiving your appellate response.

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2025-ICAP-00038
communications.communication:
11/08/2024 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 109714 
263 Huntington Avenue 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2025-ICAP-00038 

Dear Requester: 

The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, dated 10/21/2024, was received on 11/5/2024. 

The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2025-ICAP-00038 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal. 

A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter.  Should you have any questions concerning the processing of your appeal, please contact Daniel Edgington ICE FOIA Office/Public Liaison at (866) 633-1182 or at 500 12th St., SW Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 
 
Sara Jazayeri 
Chief 
Government Information Law Division 
ICE Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security

title: FOIA Requests (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Requests (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am searching for any and all documents regarding, evidencing, or detailing violations, warnings, cautions, fines, penalties, judgments, agency determinations, and/or enforcement inspections against the following entities at any time from 1972 to present:

-	BNSF Railway 
-	Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway
-	Burlington Northern Railroad
-	St. Louis–San Francisco Railway

This requests specifically seeks, but is not limited to, any records regarding violations, warnings, cautions, fines, testing, inspection, citations, survey work, agency recommendations/plans of action, or any communications with the above-named entity(-ies) regarding or related to violations of air quality, pollution, waste disposal, respiratory protection, workplace safety, and asbestos-related standards.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin LaMarca

communications.subject: 12503 - FOIA Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. LaMarca:

This letter is to acknowledge receipt of your July 18, 2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, which was received in the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA), Directorate of Enforcement Programs (DEP) for response.  Please reference FOIA tracking number 2024-F-12503 in any future correspondence concerning this request.

You request the following:

I am searching for any and all documents regarding, evidencing, or detailing violations, warnings, cautions, fines, penalties, judgments, agency determinations, and/or enforcement inspections against the following entities at any time from 1972 to present:

- BNSF Railway
- Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway
- Burlington Northern Railroad
- St. Louis-San Francisco Railway

This requests specifically seeks, but is not limited to, any records regarding violations, warnings, cautions, fines, testing, inspection, citations, survey work, agency recommendations/plans of action, or any communications with the above-named entity(-ies) regarding or related to violations of air quality, pollution, waste disposal, respiratory protection, workplace safety, and asbestos-related standards.

We are currently processing your request.  DEP has an existing backlog of FOIA requests in queue received prior to yours, so there is an expected delay.  Additionally, all FOIAs are reviewed by the Office of the Solicitor prior to release, which may protract processing time.  Please keep these considerations in mind as you await your response.
Best regards,



April Streets
Government Information Specialist
Occupational Safety and Health Administration
Directorate of Enforcement Programs (DEP)

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000056-112724
communications.communication:
Dear Toni Thompson: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of New Mexico Early Childhood Education and Care Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA) NMSA 1978, § 14-2-1. Your request was received in this office on 11/27/2024 and given the reference number R000056-112724 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: November 27, 2024

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contract awarded to Resilient 21. The total is approximately $4M and the scope of work includes professional development information system (PDIS) and early childhood information system.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant division(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: Pursuant to IPRA NMSA 1978, § 14-2-8(D), you will receive a response to your request as soon as is practicable, but not later than fifteen days after receiving your request. In addition, IPRA does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
New Mexico Early Childhood Education and Care Department 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXWKPfADcre3-2B-2BxrcgeNv2ptPN8Q1dggg2jZVZcL4kNyIybFHN2fa7ungjA9rcAmUCxpf-2BR4VgN8VhyA4nxWEh2w-3Dj-hj_evc9u1gB4kq5Yfu-2Fub43pYoy-2B-2Bvi9uPaXi9bHllEa60xrBfqqXyoniBSULBBvVTeOF2fowCirbE-2B4aWdzRdUa-2Fh8YVugkoJHtlijsoB9X5Li-2Fq2dlMuag0QBk94SUhNM97Ik07wyTFP4-2FtM05kkz7XLhcBAbAzdvEl5bIKAwNyAPmUWBhvin0Wkeip-2FgRPU4aCJBaEHJSbNC1F0xIY5kzxx2S0xf5eon1IRK8fJWw4E-3D)

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000054-112724
communications.communication:
Dear Toni Thompson: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of New Mexico Early Childhood Education and Care Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA) NMSA 1978, § 14-2-1. Your request was received in this office on 11/27/2024 and given the reference number R000054-112724 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contract issued to Sanswrite/Outlier Technologies for child care licensing mobile inspections.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant division(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: Pursuant to IPRA NMSA 1978, § 14-2-8(D), you will receive a response to your request as soon as is practicable, but not later than fifteen days after receiving your request. In addition, IPRA does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
New Mexico Early Childhood Education and Care Department 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXWKPfADcre3-2B-2BxrcgeNv2ptPN8Q1dggg2jZVZcL4kNyIybFHN2fa7ungjA9rcAmUCxpf-2BR4VgN8VhyA4nxWEh2w-3DD6IZ_ezpKrM87l9Yr6OaeikOdaLgt9p1YNom0ivsV7XW2cJ-2FPxcoxpiwz7gM-2FeAPLldBJGxP9JZyONyhRp5D6LAy1jW7DUk16uBDKPEm7EMGInjYZaOfvzHwYG4Pt41LXUbbrllWDUs3SMU8xekDTWjkOlPl5TbOWUnC2ROC6YHgK5Tia1J5xsPXbJ41OeP-2BBkcSXzV2qFXswwqprKN1oUKlrB86AJf8CP1xVteOAdlb4d2g-3D)

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Orange County District Attorney)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Orange County District Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katherine

title: Agency Roster (Jackson County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Jackson County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: VMI Board of Visitors Free Speech Issues Additional Records

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Board of Visitors Free Speech Issues Additional Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Provide all records substantiating and supporting the "legal authority the VMI Superintendent has to direct an independent student newspaper have a facult advisor or withold "privileges" (however VMI defines them) from cadets unless they agree to a faculty advisor. 
Please clarifiy this drective is in the form of a lawful order that the Superintendent is somehow empowered to issue,.

2. Maj. Gen. Wins publically stated that VMI supports freedom of speech "under certain retraints". Please provide all records of what those restrains and constraints are with their legal foundation relative to the First Amendment.

3. Documents and records related to the statement during the ExCom by Maj. Gen. Wins that and a large number of the Commandant’s staff and “the entire Executive Staff” except the athletic director were involved in developing the Permit and the MOU. The statement was made that it was “fully coordinated” and ready to go. "We've had the Dean personally involved taking, uh, taking a stab at getting this thing.... I would say that, umm, uh, it, it's a, it's been amazing to me that over, uh, the period of all this time that it's taken, uh, that it has taken the, the direct involvement of the Superintendent and/or the direct involvement of, uh, the Dean, uh, to get this done." Also, " "through the efforts of, uh, pretty much the entire executive staff, with the exception of the athletic director, we've been working on the development of a permit and an MOU for the eight or nine members of The Cadet staff. ... I think one of the things that, through this process, particularly with MY direct involvement we went back based on the direction I gave and, and we're gonna apply the permit just like we've applied every other permit." - records related to these interactions.

The scope of this request is all and/or all correspondence and other records of any kind sent to and/or received by VMI Board of Visitors President John Adams, former VMI BOV President Thomas Watjen, and/or VMI Supeintendent Cedric Wins sent to or from any person or organization, VMI and/or VMI Alumni Association staff, contractor and/or employees on the subject of The Cadet newspaper as well as any records, correspondence, records, etc. sent to or received from the VMI Alumni Agencies as well as internal VMI records regarding The Cadet newspaper for the period October 4, 2024 to the date the agency begins identifying records to fill my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #24-77
communications.communication:
Respectfully, your response appears evasive. The original request identified the records with "reasonable specificity" given the limited information and vague statements by VMI officials. The VMI superintendent stated during BOV meetings and his representatives stated to the media and in other public forums that VMI requires  the cadet on staff of The Cadet newspaper to have a "faculty advisor" as a condition of recognition and receipt of what the superintendent and his staff repeatedly referred to as a "Permit" to operate. I cannot identify the specific record(s) that the Superintendent and his staff refer to that gives them this legal authority since no VMI administrator including the Superintendent has identified them to date. In fact, request specifically asked for "all records substantiating and supporting the legal authority the VMI Superintendent has to direct an independent student newspaper have a faculty advisor or withold "privileges" (however VMI defines them) from cadets unless they agree to a faculty advisor." This request asks specifically for those records. The FOIA requirement for specificity is only so a reasonable person given the information can reasonably be expected to locate responsive records. It is not a requirement that each record be accurately names and specifically identified. I also gave you the opportunity to clarify if this directive is in the form of a lawful order that the Superintendent is somehow empowered to issue and provide that order and the supporting legal foundation for it.

Maj. Gen. Wins publically stated that VMI supports freedom of speech "under certain restraints". He did not specify what those "constraints" are. The request asked specifically for "all records of what those restraints and constraints are with their legal foundation relative to the First Amendment." 

In both cases if the public knew what authorities, restraints and constraints Maj. Gen. Wins was referring to for these actions then there would not be a need to request them under the FOIA.

During the ExCom by Maj. Gen. Wins stated that and a large number of the Commandant’s staff and “the entire Executive Staff” except the athletic director were involved in developing the Permit and the MOU. The statement was made that it was “fully coordinated” and ready to go. "We've had the Dean personally involved taking, uh, taking a stab at getting this thing.... I would say that, umm, uh, it, it's a, it's been amazing to me that over, uh, the period of all this time that it's taken, uh, that it has taken the, the direct involvement of the Superintendent and/or the direct involvement of, uh, the Dean, uh, to get this done." Also, " "through the efforts of, uh, pretty much the entire executive staff, with the exception of the athletic director, we've been working on the development of a permit and an MOU for the eight or nine members of The Cadet staff. ... I think one of the things that, through this process, particularly with MY direct involvement we went back based on the direction I gave and, and we're gonna apply the permit just like we've applied every other permit." The request is specific as to all records related to these interactions. The FOIA requirement for specificity is only so a reasonable person given the information can reasonably be expected to locate responsive records. It is not a requirement that each record be accurately names and specifically identified.

Finally, the request asks for "all correspondence and other records of any kind sent to and/or received by VMI Board of Visitors President John Adams, former VMI BOV President Thomas Watjen, and/or VMI Supeintendent Cedric Wins sent to or from any person or organization, VMI and/or VMI Alumni Association staff, contractor and/or employees on the subject of The Cadet newspaper as well as any records, correspondence, records, etc. sent to or received from the VMI Alumni Agencies as well as internal VMI records regarding The Cadet newspaper for the period October 4, 2024 to the date the agency begins identifying records to fill my request." You filled a previous request for these same records but stated that records I requested and know to exist were not within the date range of my original request and so I needed to resubmit with a broader date range. You filled that request and you should be able to fill this one. To further clarify and eliminate what appears to be your confusion in this, the scope of this request is from the date of the last document provided in my previous request to the date of this reply to your comments. Whereas I cannot reasonably know who exactly sent correspondence to the BOV and exactly what institute officials were involved it is unreasonable to require I identify specific records and persons. The FOIA requirement for specificity is only so a reasonable person given the information can reasonably be expected to locate responsive records. It is not a requirement that each record be accurately names and specifically identified.

I trust this clarifies the issue and my request will be filled expeditiously.

title: Agency Roster (San Mateo Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (San Mateo Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C200123-100624
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C200123-100624 received on October 06, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C200123-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C200123-100624. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C200123-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose Terse, 
The final report for the one investigation that is responsive to your request is now available to download in response to your request C200123-100624. Myself and several members of our HR staff went through all of our investigative records since 2019, and the investigation into former employee Steve Collins was the only investigation where the Social Media Policy was actually implicated.

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Prostitution and Related Charging Documents (Portsmouth Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All charging documents filed by your department in all cases of:

11-34.1-2. Prostitution
11-34.1-3. Procurement of sexual conduct for a fee.
11-34-11. Loitering for indecent purposes in or near schools
11-34.1-6 Soliciting from a vehicle
23-20.8-3 Practicing massage without a license

filed by your department between July of 2021 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bella Robinson

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tacoma Police Officer Christopher Bain Badge # 205807 - Copies of Sworn Traffic Safety Enforcement notices of infraction (2019-2024)
communications.communication:
Tacoma Police Officer Christopher Bain Badge # 205807 - Copies of Sworn Traffic Safety Enforcement notices of infraction (2019-2024)

via email to: pdr@cityoftacoma.org

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. An electronic copy of all City of Tacoma Traffic Safety Enforcement notices of infraction sworn to or affirmed by Officer Christopher Bain Badge # 205807 for the period of time 01-01-2019 to 02-07-2024.

2. An electronic copy of the complete nonexempt personnel or employee file for Tacoma Police Officer Christopher Bain Badge # 205807.

3. An electronic copy of any and all complaints, disciplinary actions, warnings, investigations, lawsuits, reprimands, suspensions, and/or demotions, in any way referencing or referring to Tacoma Police Officer Christopher Bain Badge # 205807.

4. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind referencing Tacoma Police Officer Christopher Bain and the TACOMA POLICE AUTOMATED ENFORCEMENT DIVISION.

5. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind referencing Tacoma Police Officer Christopher Bain and ZEROFATALITY.COM.

6. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind referencing Tacoma Police Officer Christopher Bain and the company Novoa Global, address: 8018 Sunport Dr, Suite 203, Orlando, FL 32809.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

EMAIL RECORDS

Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

REQUEST FOR CLAIRIFICATION

Hello,

On 03-18-2024 you stated:

“As we continue to process your request, it has been brought to my attention responsive records to item #1 of your request for “An electronic copy of all City of Tacoma Traffic Safety Enforcement notices of infraction sworn to or affirmed by Officer Christopher Bain Badge # 205807 for the period of time 01-01-2019 to 02-07-2024,” there are 18,8286 citations issued by Officer Bain. NoVo Global estimates the cost per citation is $5.00, which equals $91,430.00.”

1.	Please explain in detail the process the City of Tacoma would use to retrieve or export the 18,8286 citations issued by Officer Bain. Do you have an electronic dashboard or database that the citations can be exported from? Please explain the process, policy, and procedure for providing electronic copies of these identified public records in detail.

2.	Please provide a copy of the City of Tacoma Public Records Fee schedule, specifically including that portion of the fee schedule you have referenced that supports a fee of $5.00 per citation for production of these citations in electronic format  that is required to be paid by a requestor in response to a public records request.

Thank you.

title: Employee scheduling rule making records (NYS DOL)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Employee scheduling rule making records (NYS DOL)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to the "employee scheduling" or "call-in pay" rule (LAB-47-17-00011) developed under Commissioner Roberta Reardon at the direction of Governor Andrew Cuomo. Responsive documents include, but are not limited to, drafts and revisions of the proposed rule, testimony and recordings from public hearings, analyses, summaries, reports, memoranda, letters, emails and attachments prepared, issued, or received by the Commissioner, members of the Wage Board, or Department of Labor staff during the period 7/1/2017–6/30/2019.

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes. The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer to receive the responsive records in an electronic format through the online portal or by email attachment.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

04/29/2024 Peter Fugiel 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR154560 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 15, 2023, Reference # R001486-111523 Dear Peter Fugiel, The New York State Department of Labor received a public information request from you on November 15, 2023. Your request mentioned: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

All documents relating to the "employee scheduling" or "call-in pay" rule (LAB-47-17-00011) developed under Commissioner Roberta Reardon at the direction of Governor Andrew Cuomo. Responsive documents include, but are not limited to, drafts and revisions of the proposed rule, testimony and recordings from public hearings, analyses, summaries, reports, memoranda, letters, emails and attachments prepared, issued, or received by the Commissioner, members of the Wage Board, or Department of Labor staff during the period 7/1/2017–6/30/2019. 

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes. The requested documents will be made available to the general public. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer to receive the responsive records in an electronic format through the online portal or by email attachment. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Peter Fugiel 
Postdoctoral Research Fellow 
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnew-york-state-department-labor-4385%252Femployee-scheduling-rule-making-records-nys-dol-154560%252F%253Femail%253Dfoil%252540labor.ny.gov&url_auth_token=AAAXX-hx3MeDsgGxu1jfBSeuOqw%3A1r3RRZ%3ATKpQwCRANVv0eqG4yoecPfGKsFRjWWYvI26iy297GaY” Please be advised that the Department could not complete a response to your FOIL request within 90 business days due to the volume of requests currently pending with the Department and our obligation to treat each request equally. The Department estimates that you will receive a response to your request within 60 business days. Thank you, Jill Archambault Records Access Officer Maria Frank 
Legal Assistant 
Counsel's Office

communications.subject: Fwd: Attn: FOIL Appeal Officer – DOL Constructive Denial of Request #R001486-111523
communications.communication:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: dos.sm.Coog.InetCoog <dosCOOG@dos.ny.gov>
Date: Tue, Jul 30, 2024 at 12:57 PM
Subject: RE: Attn: FOIL Appeal Officer – DOL Constructive Denial of Request
#R001486-111523
To: Peter Fugiel <peter.fugiel@rutgers.edu>


Good afternoon Dr. Fugiel,



The Committee on Open Government (Committee) is authorized to provide
advice, guidance, and opinions regarding the Freedom of Information Law
(FOIL). The Committee is not empowered to hear appeals on behalf of another
agency.  Public Officers Law (POL) § 89(4)(a) states, in relevant part,
that:



“any person denied access to a record may within thirty days appeal in
writing such denial to the head, chief executive or governing body of the
entity, or the person therefor designated by such head, chief executive, or
governing body, who shall within ten business days of the receipt of such
appeal fully explain in writing to the person requesting the record the
reasons for further denial, or provide access to the record sought.”



In other words, your appeal under FOIL should be directed to the appeals
officer of the Department of Labor (DOL). Per the DOL website
<https://dol.ny.gov/freedom-information-law-foil-requests>, appeals must
“include a copy of the original request for records and a copy of the FOIL
response letter” and be submitted via U.S. mail to the following address:



Commissioner of Labor
New York State Department of Labor
Harriman State Office Campus Building 12, Room 500
Albany, NY 12226



Sincerely,



*Miguel-Carlo Bautista*

Excelsior Fellow

Pronouns: he/him/his



*New York State Committee on Open Government *

One Commerce Plaza, Albany, NY 12231

(518) 474-2518

http://www.opengovernment.ny.gov



*From:* Peter Fugiel <peter.fugiel@rutgers.edu>
*Sent:* Tuesday, July 30, 2024 1:08 PM
*To:* dos.sm.Coog.InetCoog <dosCOOG@dos.ny.gov>
*Cc:* 154560-71844526@requests.muckrock.com; labor.sm.Counsel.FOILReq <
FOILReq.Counsel@labor.ny.gov>
*Subject:* Attn: FOIL Appeal Officer – DOL Constructive Denial of Request
#R001486-111523



You don't often get email from peter.fugiel@rutgers.edu. Learn why this is
important <https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

*ATTENTION: This email came from an external source. Do not open
attachments or click on links from unknown senders or unexpected emails.*



Dear Appeal Officer,


Please find attached a letter appealing the Department of Labor's failure
to respond to a FOIL request (R001486-111523) for records relating to
proposed employee scheduling or call-in pay regulations. Please let me know
if you have any difficulty opening the attachment or require additional
documentation.



Thank you for your assistance,



*Peter Fugiel, PhD* | Postdoctoral Research Fellow

Department of Labor Studies and Employment Relations

Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations



[image: Image removed by sender.]

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes. The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Please be advised that access is denied to information which “would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy" pursuant to Public Officers Law §§ 87(2)(b), 89(2)(b), and 96(1). communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like the accident report for an car crash that occurred on 11/19/2024 at or around 2641 Rockmart Hwy Cedartown, Ga. The accident would have taking out a utility pole and the pole was replaced at the time of the accident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tommy Grainger

title: Agency Roster (Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: P001901-112524
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

   
    
 
  
 Re: Public Records Request of November 25, 2024. Reference #: P001901-112524 
Dear Marcus Boyd, On November 25, 2024, you requested: Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency. Please include; 
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding; 
- badge number 
- employee identification number 
- hire date 
- rank or position 
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location 
- current salary 

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations. 

The Santa Barbara Sheriff's Office has identified records that appear to be responsive to your records request. A current staff roster with redactions has been provided. To protect the identity of peace officers who require anonymity to perform their duties effectively or to protect their own safety, some peace officers are exempt from public disclosure and redacted according to the California Public Records Act. More specifically: Peace Officer Standards and Training v. Superior Court (2007) 42 Cal. 4th 278 [names of peace officers, their employing departments and dates of employment are public records subject to disclosure]. Hereafter "the POST decision."). 
For the full text of the court's decision, go to: 
https:/ /caselaw. find law .com/ca-supreme-court/1387 579.html 
Additionally, a current Salary Table Report is provided, and employee earnings are publicly available via public pay and pension databases such as: 
Transparent California: https://transparentcalifornia.com/ 
Government Jobs: https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/sbcounty/classspecs 
County of Santa Barbara Human Resources: https://www.countyofsb.org/1392/Classification-Compensation 
Responsive documents have been released to our online Public Records Center. You can log into the system and download your responsive records. 
Should you have any additional questions or concerns, please respond to this email. 
Sincerely, 
Daniel Calderon 
Records Sergeant 
Admin Staff

communications.subject: Your West Sacramento public records request #24-455 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
West Sacramento ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-455 has been submitted successfully. Your records request has been received and forwarded to the appropriate staff member for review.  You will be notified within (10) days whether your request seeks copies of disclosable public records in the possession of this agency. In most cases, your request will be processed in two to four weeks, or sooner.  The City may invoke an extension of time to determine if there is a need to: * Search for and collect the requested records from field facilities. * Search for and examine a voluminous number of records. * Consult with another agency or City departments having a substantial interest in the determination of the request. * Compile data. If your request is to review records (rather than receive copies), an appointment will be made with you for review once the records are gathered.  Please note:  If any responsive documents are copyrighted they can only be viewed in house.  No duplicate or photos are allowed. There is a charge for the direct cost of duplication pursuant to the City’s Book of fees. Payment must be made prior to release of records requested. If the documents requested exceed 50 pages, a deposit may be requested. Records available for review and/or copies of records requested will be available for 10 days after notification of their availability. If you are unable to pick-up or view your records during this time period, notification is required or your request will be considered fulfilled and a new request must be made. Certain records are generally exempt for disclosure pursuant to Government Code Section 6255, where the public interest served by not making the records public clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the records. The Government Code further provides that certain other records are specifically exempt from disclosure. JANET CHAPAN, MMC Sr. Deputy City Clerk 1110 W. Capitol Avenue, 3rd Floor West Sacramento, CA 95691 Telephone: (916) 617-4526 janetc@cityofwestsacramento.org     ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact West Sacramento.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center
