communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
Dear Madeleine Stone:

The New York State Energy Research and Development Authority continues to review the emails and attachments responsive to your Freedom of Information Law request.  This review includes determining whether any information should be withheld from disclosure under the exemptions set forth in NY Public Officers Law section 87(2).  I note that any emails or attachments which include proprietary, confidential, or business sensitive information are required to undergo an additional review by ICF as set forth in NY Public Officers Law section 89(5).  This additional review entails NYSERDA seeking a confidentiality justification letter from ICF, ICF reviewing each responsive email and attachment sent to it and drafting a letter to NYSERDA with its confidentiality assertions.

Given this, NYSERDA anticipates completing its review of the responsive records no later than September 20.

Thank you for your continued patience.


Colleen Dawson
Senior Counsel

NYSERDA

title: 2023 UAV Flight Logs & UAS Deployment Requests

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: 2023 UAV Flight Logs & UAS Deployment Requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- All written requests for UAS deployment from January 1, 2023, through December 31, 2023.

- The flight logs from January 1, 2023, to December 31, 2023, for all unmanned aerial drones and vehicles used by the department.

Please see this link as an example of the format of records that I am requesting. https://www.muckrock.com/foi/carson-city-county-8863/carson-city-sheriff-drone-program-140470/#comms

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ariel Van Cleve

communications.subject: Town of Gilbert - Records Request Confirmation- GPDR2024-19852
communications.communication:
* 
  
   
  
 Thank you for submitting a records request to the Town of Gilbert. 
  
 We strive to complete routine requests as promptly as possible, but keep in mind that the Town of Gilbert is closed on Fridays and most government holidays. 
  
 Various factors also affect processing time, including the size and complexity of the request, nature of the records sought, and parameters provided.  The records provided to you will be based off the specific search parameters and keywords defined in your records request.   
  
 You can check the check the status of your request or access your documents by clicking on the reference number link below.  Remember to check your spam filter or junk mail folder for any email correspondence from the Town.  
  
 Reference number is Request Number: GPDR2024-19852. 
  
 Security key is EA2B7759.  
  
   
  
 For questions regarding requests, please email to the below: 
  
  
 Public, Build (Eplan) and GIS = ClerksOffice@gilbertaz.gov.  
  
  
 Police Records = gilbertpdrecords@gilbertaz.gov. 
  
  
 EMS Records (Patient Care Reports and Billing) and Fire Reports (Incident and/or Inspection) = GFRD.records@gilbertaz.gov  
  
  
 You must provide your security key and reference number when inquiring about your records request.   
  
   
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Town Of Gilbert 
 50 East Civic Center Drive | Gilbert, AZ 85296 
 Mon-Thurs, 7:00am - 6:00pm; Closed Fridays

communications.subject: Gilbert Police Department - Public Record Request
communications.communication:
Hello Ariel Van Cleve, 
 We have completed your Record Request: Request Number: GPDR2024-19852 
 The data pertaining to UAS Deployment that you Requested is available within the Request Page. You can access that Request page using the Link above. 
 That link allows you access to the Results up to a Year. The Document can be located at the Bottom of the Request Page. 
 Feel free to give us a call at (480)635-7020 if you have any questions Regarding this Request.

title: 2023 H2 IAPro data

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: 2023 H2 IAPro data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the listing of OPA allegations in IAPro since June 1, 2023 with columns:
 Occurred date    OPA #    CAD/Incident No    ID number    First name    Last name    Date hired    Incident type    Directive    Finding    Finding date    Action taken    Employee Type 
I request the listing be provided in Excel format so I can easily sort/filter it. Redactions should be done in Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: P185314-061024
communications.communication:
This email is in further response to your public disclosure records request P185314-061024. The Seattle Police Department has records ready to be released pending payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 SPD strongly encourages online payments. 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: P185314-061024. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-P185314-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. After we receive your payment through the Police Records Request Center Secure Payments, the Public Disclosure Unit will release your records within one to two business days and send you a notice with instructions on how to download the records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

11/27/2024 
 
Rose Terse 
164840-66651629@requests.muckrock.com 
 
RE: Public Disclosure Request#: P185314-061024 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 
Your records have been released and are available on the Public Records Request Center to download. 
We are providing an Excel spreadsheet containing a listing of OPA allegations in IAPRO since June 1, 2023. This concludes OPA's response to your request and your request is now closed. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: P185314-061024. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
OPA will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so within 10 business days. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Please include your name and address, a copy of any redacted files, and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. 
Please submit your appeal via GovQA, the mail, or deliver your appeal to: 
The Office of Police Accountability 
ATTN: Public Disclosure Officer 
P.O. Box 34986 
Seattle, WA 98124-4986 
 
If you have any questions, you may send a message using the Police Records Request Center or call the Public Disclosure Desk at 206-684-5481. 
 
Sincerely, 
Dianalynn Oreiro
